fields.description: There is currenlty no way to set a global default of settings for deny non-fast-forwards and deny branch deletions for an organization so that any repo's created in an organization inherit this functionality.
fields.summary: Add ability to set default for deny non-fast-forwards and deny branch deletions for an organization (BB-7958)

fields.description:
Steps to repro:

* create a team and a group within it that has write permission and the ability to create new repositories
* invite some members to the group
* remove the ability to create new repositories from the group

Result is that all members of the group are sent an email which says, in it's entirety:

{code}
From: Bitbucket <notifications-noreply@bitbucket.org>
Date: Mon, [DATE]
Subject: You are no longer a member of [TEAM NAME]
To: [TEAM MEMBER]

Your membership of the [TEAM NAME] team has been revoked.
{code}

This message is also plastered all over the team's activity log once for each team member.

You then have to re-assure your team that their access has not in fact been revoked.

Expected behavior is that team members would be notified of the specific change in their permissions. It would also be nice if in the activity stream, there was only one message for the group's permission change rather than a steam of messages for each user.
fields.summary: Rude and inaccurate email sent automatically to team members (BB-7971)

Thx

fields.description:
Ability to add custom links in {{repo tabs}} and/or {{repo sub-tabs}}.

{{Repo tabs}} links is "overview", "source", "commits", etc.

{{Repo sub-tabs}} is sub-tabs for {{repo tabs}}.\\
For example, repo tab "issues" has repo sub-tabs "create issue", "filter all", "filter open", "filter my issues", etc.

Use cases:

* Roadmap
* Custom filters to search in-one-click.
fields.summary: Ability to add custom links in `repo tabs` and/or `repo sub-tabs`

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I'm trying to migrate our current repository. I'm following the howto that we have received regarding this migration - http://go-dvcs.atlassian.com/display/aod/Migrating+from+Subversion+to+Git+on+Bitbucket\\
I'm on step "Upload". Now, when I try to upload the locally created git repo to bitbucket with command:\\
java -jar svn-migration-scripts.jar bitbucket-push dealmarket PASSWORD_REMOVED  dealmarket DM\\
I'm receiving error:\\
ERROR: Error creating Git remote: https://dealmarket:PASWORD_REMOVED@bitbucket.org/dealmarket/dm\\
I have removed the password from the command and the error but I'm sure that I have tried with the correct one. The repository itself is created and I receive an email with subject "You have hereby been granted admin access to dealmarket/dm.", but no data is imported in this repo because of the error we get.

I have also tried to use the command:\\
java -jar svn-migration-scripts.jar bitbucket-push pbojkov PASSWORD_REMOVED  pbojkov DM\\
This command works without errors it imports all the data from the local git repo, but it creates the repository 'pbojkov/DM" which is not what we want. We want the repo to be named dealmarket/DM.\\
Please advice how to proceed.
fields.summary: error migrating current svn repository

fields.description:
Something really strange going on with this pull request:

https://bitbucket.org/spookylukey/semanticeditor/pull-request/6/use-only-the-first-part-of-the-language/diff

# When I first looked at it, it contained a pull request for the following commit:

https://bitbucket.org/paparent/semanticeditor/commits/9aa8b59c393bf329288d21d4cac79f7d883c566f

The diff displayed as on that URL (changes to single file, semanticeditor/widgets.py)

# I pushed some more changes to my repo (spookylukey/semanticeditor), in this case 112e232 and 050ceca
# I refreshed the pull request page, in case it showed some problems, but it didn't.
# I pressed 'Merge', and it came back with an error "Unexpected merge error" (or something like that, I closed the window I'm afraid).

However, from the history, the merge had succeeded:

https://bitbucket.org/spookylukey/semanticeditor/commits/5c74d9f2ac67fda8615f6e28c7245a0b5aed2470

# Going back to the pull request, it now shows a different diff  - I think a reverse diff of the other commits that I had added. This is totally confused.
fields.summary: Pull request corruption/brokenness

fields.description:

It turned out he was in a group that used to have write access to another repository.

I don't think new repositories should automatically be allocated to anyone other than the creator by default.

I'd suggest doing as GitHub does and including a hash in the Reply-To address which identifies the thread and me.

(Thank goodness 99% of the bugs I follow are on GitHub and thank goodness for the AwesomeBar. If I were on Chrome, it'd take forever and only the non-local results would be relevant.)

fields.description:
When a comment is placed on an issue, the notification mail body looks like this:

----
--- you can reply above this line ---

Issue 797: Make flexible setup to retrieve all commits for changelog\\
/marcinkuzminski/rhodecode/issue/797/make-flexible-setup-to-retrieve-all

Marcin Kuzminski:

configurable option is now merged to beta.

Changes:\\
status: new -> resolved

--

h2. This is an issue notification from bitbucket.org. You are receiving\\
this either because you are the owner of the issue, or you are\\
following the issue.
Meaning there is _no_ http link to the issue itself, which is kind of bad to be honest.

Solution: Add a link to the issue in the mail body so users can easily browse to the updated issue.

fields.description:
Preface, I didn't know the proper channel to send this on through, but I figured I'd give it a shot placing it here.

As a user, owning multiple repositories is  a very real possibility. Organizing these repositories is a chore. As an agency user having hundreds of repositories is expected. A way of tagging repositories would help solve this problem. Currently my Team has 55 repositories. We are naming them in such ways as [wordpress] [theme] newproject.com or [custom] [platform] projectname.

This is currently allowing us to filter the projects using existing methods within the system and finding types of projects such as codebases or libraries is easy through the user dashboard.

The downside is that this leads to bloated repository names and frequent renaming of repositories.

Request: Add tagging to repositories. A user would go into a repository and have a box somewhere on the screen that would allow for comma separated tags.

The request is minor at this time, but as we proceed throughout the year, 200 repositories is a reality we expect to have to deal with. Then searching through them will be cumbersome and may require elevation.

Thanks for your time!
fields.summary: Repository Tagging

fields.description:
Please support one or both of the following syntaxes for easier linking between internal wiki pages when using Markdown:

* {{[[Page name]]}} (Creole-style)
* {{[Page name]()}} (Techically an empty link in markdown but makes sense to link to a wiki page with specified title)

Currently I there seems to be no way of linking to a wiki in Markdown without duplicating page name:

{{[Page name](Page name)}}

fields.description: Bitbucket attempts to auto-merge pull requests that were merged locally via a rebase. It would be great if Bitbucket could detect more unique workflows and situations where rebasing may cause the pull request to lose track of the commits or branches. Or detect when a user has rebased and merged, then removed the branch that the pull request was the source/destination of.
fields.summary: Detect and handle rebasing and auto-merge in more situations

fields.description: Currently, BitBucket's feature branch logic does not detect bookmarks. It seems that, if the user has an {{@}} bookmark, it would be reasonable to consider other bookmarks ahead of it to be feature branches.
fields.summary: Bookmarks not recognized as feature branches (BB-7874)

fields.description:
I placed an .apk (android app format) file in Downloads section of my repo. When a user downloads the file, the server returns "Content-Type: binary/octet-stream" header, which I assume is a fallback for all unrecognized types.

The problem is that Android requires "application/vnd.android.package-archive" mime type to recognize that the download is an app [1]. As it is now, if a user tries to install the downloaded app, Android default download manager fails with an unhelpful message "Can't open file".

The solution would be to return the correct mime header for .apk downloads.

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3253079/cant-install-apk-from-browser-downloads?rq=1#comment3363818_3253100
fields.summary: Incorrect MIME type header for *.apk downloads (BB-7870)

Typed in 97 or BCLOUD-97, and expected to see a ticket BCLOUD-97 show up in search results. Especially with the latter, I expected to see only ticket 97, but for some reason, BCLOUD-97 doesn't show up at all in either search.

It would be nice to have the ability to jump right to the ticket with specified number.

fields.description:
When reviewing pull request many files are too wide to nicely fit in the window, and too tall to fit on the screen.

So, I need to scroll horizontally to be able to see the source, but I need to scroll to the bottom of the file section to be able to scroll horizontally. I'm ending up either doing a lot of scrolling, or just give up on the file, which is bad.
fields.summary: Simplify horizontal scrolling in pull request window (BB-8024)

fields.description:
One feature of Github I really miss on Bitbucket is the possibility to create project pages by simply add html files to a branch called gh-pages.

Wouldn't such a feature be great for bitbucket, too? There is something called user pages here, but I don't want to give collaborators of just one project access to the whole user-pages-repo. Better would be really a branch, for example bb-pages, that one can create on every repo one wants to host a webpage for. Then every collaborator with write-access is also able to modify / maintain those page.
fields.summary: Support for project webpages (BB-7880)

fields.description: We have a setup where each team member maintains his own fork of the master repository on team's account. We need to go between the master repository and our fork countless times during our work day. It would be super-convenient if there was link to my fork on the upstream repository's page, just like there is a link to the upstream on my fork's page, right at the top below the repository name.
fields.summary: Link to my fork

The Atlassian page I am asked to log-in to seems to know nothing about this BitBucket account. I do not want to lose the privelages associated with BitBucket. I dont actually care about Atlassian at all.. I just want to check the repo I have privs on, on BitBucket. All else is frustration..

fields.description: We are using SourceTree as our client and we are using the GitFlow functionality to create feature and release branches.  When we do this and we go to the BitBucket UI and navigate to Downloads for our repository and try to download the zip for different branches we get an internal error for some of the branches and not for others.  Initial testing suggests that all branches with a forward slash (/) in the name fail and all branches without a forward slash in the name succeed.  Please see the attached document for examples.

fields.description:
According to the help panel the shortcut {{/}} should focus the site search

Instead it brings up the *help panel*. So either the help panel is wrong, or the documentation, or this is a bug due to the German keyboard layout. Maybe because {{/}} is a shift-combination on {{7}} on this layout instead of being a key without modifiers.

Info:

* Keyboard layout is Mac/German
* I will test later on a Windows/German layout
* This happens in Firefox as well as Chrome
* Since this also overloads the default Firefox shortcut for on-page search, this is even more annoying
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts don't handle international keyboard layout properly (BB-8062)

fields.description:
None of the Emacs-style key combinations is working, they always bring up the "search by typing" search on the first character instead of starting a key combination.

For example {{G}} - {{I}}

* As soon as I type the {{G}}, the search box pops up with a {{G}} in it (of course)
* This only occurs when the option "Search for text when I start typing" in the Advanced > General option panel is enabled.
* In Gmail those kind of short-cuts _do_ work even with the option enabled, so it _is_ possible
fields.summary: Emacs-style keyboard shortcuts not working in Firefox with "Search for text when I start typing" enabled (BB-7952)

fields.description:
I have 2 accounts, one for work (noxqsgit) and one private (obfusk). My private account is set to follow my work account. The newsfeed of my private account contains private team changes from my work account. Also, when I'm logged in with my private account, and visit the page of my work account, I can see which teams it is a part of, and how many members and repositories they have. Whilst not exactly problematic, there does seem to be some unexpected information leakage.

- Felix

Emails (BB-7878)

fields.description:
Just after a recent commit by another team member, everyone on the team is getting "HTTP Error: 500 (Internal Server Error)" when attempting to check or pull incoming changes.

If I switch to SSH, I get "abort: stream ended unexpectedly (got 0 bytes, expected 4)"
fields.summary: 500 error

fields.description:
Hi,

I tried to comment on a single commit yesterday but it didn't work.\\
Added a comment, wrote my message, pressed comment ... wheel spinning ... clicking outside and refresh -> message gone :(

A colleague (who provided the video) tried it out too. Same behaviour!

Did we miss something, or is it currently broken?

Cheers\\
K:)
fields.summary: Commenting on a commit does not work properly (BB-7900)

fields.description:
Hello,

I am unable to push anything to my git repo on your server.

You might be interested in the below git log I see on my terminal.

http://pastebin.com/kuJdD3Sv
fields.summary: Unable to push objects to git repo (unpacker error)

fields.description:
For groups on a Team account, the group setting: _Has [permission] access to this account's repositories_, where Permission is: _no, read, write, or admin_, seems both extraneous and non-functional.

My experience is that for any group to have access to a repo, that group must explicitly be added to the repo using the _Access Management_ feature of the repo.  At the time a group is added, one must also set the group's permissions (read, write, admin) against the repo.  The default group setting seems to have no effect.

If I create a new group on a Team account, and I set: _Has *Admin* access to this account' s repositories_. Members of that group *do not* suddenly gain admin level access to the account's repositories.  As mentioned, the group must be added explicitly to individual repos, via the repo's _Access Management_ feature, setting its permission level at the time it is added.
fields.summary: Team Group default permissions non-functional

fields.description:
Heyo -

I'm attempting to set up my SSH key, but the AJAX request from the modal window that saves the keys is getting a 400 error.

URI throwing error: https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/users/jamisonvalenta/ssh-keys

I can hit the URI by typing it into my browser(returns an empty JSON array), but the AJAX request is definitely failing (see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Strip comment when validating SSH keys (BB-7903)

fields.description: Users can enter secondary e-mail addresses for their account. When doing so, it allows you to enter the same e-mail address twice as long as the case is different (eg JohnDoe@bitbucket.com v. johndoe@bitbucket.com). Once logged in, the users gets a notification that one of the e-mail addresses has not been confirmed. When you go to the page to see which one it has an option to remove associated e-mail addresses. Since the two are essentially matching, the validation thinks you are trying to remove the validated e-mail and says that you cannot.
fields.summary: Remove Secondary E-mail Address When Same (BB-10065)

fields.description:
I'm getting the following error when trying to create my second repo (I am on a different computer than the one I used to create the first repo).

Here's the bash log:

$ git push -u origin --all\\
Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.
fields.summary: git push -u origin --all

fields.description: The main RSS activity feed for my account has URL links in the <guid> element as opposed to actual unique GUIDs per item. Apart from being invalid RSS this is confusing my teams automatic RSS notification processes. Any chance this could be fixed?
fields.summary: RSS Feed Non-unique GUID element

fields.description:
When accessing the "blame" feature via a repo's custom domain, all author and commit links on the left 404.  Accessing the same repo via the bitbucket.org domain and the blame author/commit links work as expected.

The following examples use the same source file and version.

Via custom domain, all author/commit links will 404\\
http://hg.jasonscott.org/copydsacl/annotate/3eab002cd9a619c8e2485a5adf4e98243f7c78f8/CopyDsAcl.ps1?at=default

Via bitbucket.org, all author/commit links will work:\\
https://bitbucket.org/jasonkeithscott/copydsacl/annotate/3eab002cd9a619c8e2485a5adf4e98243f7c78f8/CopyDsAcl.ps1?at=default

It appears the links in the custom domain include the username, "jasonkeithscott" in my case, removing the username from the link works.

Link provided via blame, 404s:\\
http://hg.jasonscott.org/jasonkeithscott/copydsacl/annotate/3eab002cd9a619c8e2485a5adf4e98243f7c78f8/CopyDsAcl.ps1?at=default

Editing the url to this works:\\
http://hg.jasonscott.org/copydsacl/annotate/3eab002cd9a619c8e2485a5adf4e98243f7c78f8/CopyDsAcl.ps1?at=default
fields.summary: Custom domain blame author and commit links 404 (BB-7848)

fields.description: An issue comment contains a link to a changeset. When this issue is viewed from a custom domain, it points to the wrong URL - bitbucket.org/repo/changeset instead of bitbucket.org/owner/repo/changeset
fields.summary: Link to changeset from custome domain is wrong (BB-7855)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I've found a small bug inside a repository: when you select the repo URL between HTTPS and SSH, but go again over the drop-down list, the hover is always on HTTPS, even when you select SSH.

To fix this bug I would guess you just need to allow the .active class on "#clone-url-dropdown-overview ul li:last-child".
fields.summary: Choosing between HTTPS and SSH (BB-7850)

fields.description: Currently working and dead links are displayed in the same color. This makes it hard to incrementally create or migrate wiki content, because it's not at all obvious what pages are there and what are missing. It'd be very helpful if dead links were displayed in another (red) color.
fields.summary: Display wiki dead links in a different color

fields.description: It seems that in a private repository one partner can only has one remote branch in bitbucket. For instance I cannot use {{git push origin newly}} to push a local branch into _another branch on bitbucket_ after I have already had one(I am not the owner of the repository). I didn't find an item telling me that explicitly, so I suppose that something gets wong.
fields.summary: remote branch limitation

fields.description: I delete many files  in [this commits|https://bitbucket.org/hucheng/moonbox/commits/761fc7fee359a08d0c7b7b4f38d00608b7269083], and the commits diff cannot be seen from the web page now.
fields.summary: Can't get one of the commits change page (BB-7854)

fields.description:
Target page:\\
https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/ondemand-fireball/pull-request/18/fix-ssh-config

Tabs load up fine, but then reverts to error message.
fields.summary: Getting Oops! Something went wrong in pull Request

fields.description:
Would be great to see some syntax support for the new [literate coffee-script|http://ashkenas.com/literate-coffeescript] when viewing {{.litcoffee}} files.

It basically mimics markdown, however all code blocks are in coffee-script.
fields.summary: .litcoffee files should be rendered as markdown (BB-10063)

fields.description:
My team account members cannot see the detail of a groups of my team\\
account. As I described in\\
https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/bitbucket-users/02rMewNCiAs

Since they cannot see who in which group, they even don't know what groups\\
they belong to, if I didn't tell them.\\
That would be sometimes confused when a repo admin want to setup the access\\
right of a repo.
fields.summary: Let team member see which member is currently in a group of team (BB-7859)

fields.description:
Hello,

I have enabled the issue tracker on my repository and made it public so that anyone can create issues. This feature seems to work well, however, I cannot find a way to eliminate the "assignee" filed from the issue tracker's interface. In my case, it is not appropriate to have this field exposed for the public.

I simply want my users to report issues and not have to consider which developer should be tasked with addressing the issue.
fields.summary: Public Issue Tracket (BB-7851)

fields.description:
Hi Bitbucket!

Thought I'd tell you about this ux/bug -- you can't change the name of your repo in "Repository details"  if it's the same name.

You get: "You already have a repository with this name."

But you _should_ be able to if it's the _same repo_!

For example, if I want to change my repo name from "mycode" to "Mycode" (i.e. Capitalise it) you will get this error.

Thought I'd share!

Thanks.
fields.summary: Can't change name of *already existing* repo. (BB-7856)

fields.description: When there are several parallel branches, the first parent in a merge commit is sometimes directly below and sometimes to the side. This makes it more difficult to visually trace branches than with the text layout in {{git log --graph --oneline --decorate}}, for example. Presumably this would be a minor tweak to the existing layout algorithm, or a small indicator on the line going to the first parent.
fields.summary: Distinguish "first parent" in commit graph layout (BB-7901)

fields.description:
Hello,

Github has a contribution tracker, which includes a current streak of contributions. This is a great productivity tool and I think Bitbucket would benefit from having a similar streak tracker.

best,

Bastiaan
fields.summary: github style streak as a productivity tool

fields.description: Obsolete markers have been in core for a few versions now but with Mercurial 2.5, exchanging them on a server requires only two lines in the .hgrc, similar to issue BCLOUD-4560.  Without exchanging these markers, this is a huge road block for using the changeset evolution workflow.
fields.summary: Enable exchange of obsolete (evolve) markers for Mercurial (BB-7852)

fields.description:
We are using a topic branch workflow where members of our team push topic branches to allow passive review. Unmerged topic branches may be modified and updated (non-ff) before being merged to {{next}} (either directly or via pull request) and later graduating to {{master}}. Usually topic branches are deleted after graduating to {{master}}. After a release, {{next}} is rewound to pick up any topic branches that didn't make the release. This workflow is pretty simple for our team and gives us a convenient display of everything being worked on, even before creating PRs.

https://bitbucket.org/petsc/petsc/commits/featurebranches

The problem is that forks include all branches by default, which become outdated when upstream deletes them or non-ff pushes them. I would like to restrict forks to only include the branches that are intended to fast-forward ({{maint}} and {{master}}).

Note that this branch proliferation isn't a problem when cloning via the git client because {{git fetch --prune}} cleans up.
fields.summary: Limit which branches appear in a fork
